item.title: Aphelion Is A Sci-Fi Game Game About Crashing On An Alien Planet From Don’t Nod
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/xbox-games-showcase/2025/06/08/aphelion-is-a-sci-fi-game-game-about-crashing-on-an-alien-planet

The creators of Life is Strange are leaving Earth. Aphelion is the latest from Don't Nod, and it is leaning decidedly science-ficiton. The game appears to follow two astronauts who crash-land on an alien planet. It is also being developed in partnership with The European Space Agency.

Aphelion is coming to Xbox platforms, PC, and PlayStation 5 next year. It was odd to see a PlayStation logo on screen during an Xbox showcase, but not entirely surprising considering how platform-agnostic Xbox has become in recent years.

item.title: Grounded 2 Announced With July Game Preview Release Date
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/xbox-games-showcase/2025/06/08/grounded-2-announced-with-july-game-preview-release-date

2020’s Grounded was a surprise success story for Obsidian Entertainment and Xbox, having brought in some 15 million players by the end of 2022. It’s clear that success was not lost on the game makers, as today brought the announcement of Grounded 2, a brand new game in the series. 

Grounded 2 follows up on the premise of the original game, this time seeing the adventurous kids navigating a local park, riding ants, running along picnic tables and fallen popsicles, and battling a bevy of spiders and scorpions. 

Grounded 2 is closer than you might expect for a newly announced project; expect it to arrive to Xbox Game Preview on July 29. 

It’s great to see the early success of the franchise be rewarded with another entry, though we’re left to wonder how Obsidian is staying on top of so many projects. With Avowed earlier this year, Grounded 2 in Game Preview this summer, and The Outer Worlds 2 now set for October, that development house has had a very busy year.

item.title: Hollow Knight Silksong Will Be Out By Holiday 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/xbox-showcase/2025/06/08/hollow-knight-silksong-will-be-out-by-holiday-2025

Xbox started its annual summer showcase with a bang, announcing a new dedicated handheld less than 10 minutes into the showcase. But perhaps what's even more surprising than Xbox finally diving into the handheld race is the reveal that Hollow Knight Silksong, one of the most anticipated games of every year since its announcement, will be coming to the console at launch this holiday.

The showcase might still show off a proper trailer for Team Cherry's metroidvania sequel, but as it stands, all we saw was some new clips of protagonist Hornet platforming through a dangerous-looking area full of spinning blades and acrobatically attacking various bug-shaped enemies.

The game was at an Xbox summer showcase three years ago, when it was promised to launch sometime within the next 12 months. It was obviously delayed. The last time we saw it, however, was at the Nintendo Switch 2 Direct, when we learned it would be coming out later this year. 

It's worth noting that the trailer didn't say the game would be launching with the Xbox handheld, just that "it will be available at launch," according to Xbox president Sarah Bond. This means the game could launch any time between then and now, but whenever the Xbox handheld has a release date, we'll know Silksong is due out before then. 

At the very least, it sounds like Team Cherry is doubling down on 2025, so if it doesn't launch this year, it will be more surprising than ever.

item.title: Ninja Gaiden 4 Gets October Release Date In Bloody New Trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/xbox-games-showcase/2025/06/08/ninja-gaiden-4-gets-october-release-date-in-bloody-new-trailer

Publisher Koei Tecmo and developer PlatinumGames have released a new look at their upcoming character action game, Ninja Gaiden 4, and it ends with an October release date. More specifically, Ninja Gaiden 4 hits PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC on October 21. 

This news was revealed during today's Xbox Games Showcase 2025, where we received another bloody look at the game. Plus, if you pre-order the game, you'll receive the Dark Dragon Desendant Yakumo skin at launch later this year. 

Check it out for yourself in the Ninja Gaiden 4 Release Date trailer below: 

"Embark on a cutting-edge adventure where legacy meets innovation in a high-octane blend of style and no-holds-barred combat," the game's description reads. 

Ninja Gaiden 4 hits PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC on October 21. In the meantime, read about Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound, the throwback dual-protagonist action game launching next month.
